sen.j: 藤原 誠信（ふじわら の さねのぶ、康保元年（964年） - 長保3年9月3日 (旧暦)（1001年9月27日）は、平安時代中期の公卿。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Sanenobu (964 to September 28, 1001) was a Kugyo (the top court officials) who lived during the mid Heian period.
sen.cmt: 長保3年9月3日は西暦1001年9月28日のようです。http://maechan.net/kanreki/

sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一して、ハイフンにしました。

sen.j: 太政大臣藤原為光の長男。
sen.e: He was the eldest son of FUJIWARA no Tamemitsu, who held the title of Daijo-daijin (Grand minister of state).

He held the titles of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank), Sangi (councillor), and Saemon no kami (captain of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards).

He held the rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and the titles of Sangi (councilor) and Saemon no kami (captain of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: 従三位は官位ですので、rank としました。

sen.j: 幼少時には、7歳で『李嶠百二十詠』という詩集を暗証する等の物覚えの良さを見せた。
sen.e: He was a quick learner as a young boy and recited "Rikyo Hyakuniju Ei" (An anthology of 120 poems by Li Jiao) at the age of 7.

sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。

sen.j: 父の為光も誠信の為に、当時の有名な文人源為憲に貴族の幼童用の教科書『口遊』の編纂を依頼したり、あるいはに異母兄の摂政藤原兼家に懇願を重ねて参議に就任させたりと、大いに将来を期待していた。
sen.e: His father, Tamemitsu, placed high expectations on Sanenobu, and asked MINAMOTO no Tamenori, a renowned litterateur at the time, to compile "Kuchizusami", a textbook for young aristocrats, and repeatedly implored his half elder brother FUJIWARA no Kaneie, who held the title of Sessho (regent), to make his son a Sangi.

sen.j: （なお、この際に為光が、誠信の競争相手であった小野宮流の藤原実資の悪口を兼家に吹聴していたとされる（『小右記』））
sen.e: (It is believed that Tamemitsu ran a smear campaign against Sanenobu's competitor, FUJIWARA no Sanesuke of the Ononomiya school, and brought a slanderous report to Kaneie ("Shoyuki", Diary of FUJIWARA no Sanesuke)).

sen.j: しかし、長ずるにつれ、父同様に政治能力に欠けてる事が明らかになり、その上酒好きで酒席での失態も多かった。
sen.e: However, as Sanenobu grew older, it revealed that he took after his father and lacked his competence as a politician, and he also took to drink and often made a blunder at parties.

sen.j: 切れ者であった同母弟の藤原斉信に比して人望を失っていった。
sen.e: He gradually lost his popularity against his clever younger brother-uterine, FUJIWARA no Tadanobu.

sen.j: 欠員ができた中納言への昇格を望み、あらかじめ斉信に対し自分を出し抜いて昇任申請をしないよう言い含めるが、誠信の能力に疑問を抱く藤原道長の後押しを受けた斉信が中納言に任ぜられた。
sen.e: Hoping to take over the vacant position of the vice-councilor of state, he told Tadanobu not to apply for the promotion in advance, but was defeated when FUJIWARA no Michinaga who doubted Sanenobu's competence backed up Tadanobu to be appointed to the vice-councilor of state.

Hoping to take over the vacant position of the vice-councilor of state, he told Tadanobu not to apply for a promotion in advance, but was defeated when FUJIWARA no Michinaga, who doubted Sanenobu's competence, backed up Tadanobu's appointment as vice-councilor of state.

Hoping to take over the vacant position of Chunagon (vice-councilor of state), he told Tadanobu not to apply for a promotion in advance, but was defeated when FUJIWARA no Michinaga, who doubted Sanenobu's competence, backed up Tadanobu's appointment as Chunagon.
sen.cmt: 中納言 を追加しました。

sen.j: このことにより誠信は、道長と斉信を深く恨み、憤激・絶食の末に病を得て没した。
sen.e: Defeated in the campaign, Sanenobu felt deep animosity against Michinaga and Tadanobu; he was inflamed by anger, refused to eat, and finally fell ill and died.

sen.j: 『大鏡』の描写によればその有様は、握り締めた手の指が手の甲を突き破るほど凄まじいものであったという。
sen.e: According to the description of "Okagami" (The Great Mirror), his suffering was so horrible that his clenched fingers gored in the hand and penetrated its back.
According to the description of "Okagami" (The Great Mirror), his suffering was so horrible that his clenched fingers gored the palm of his hand and penetrated its back.
